meanings.definition: Importing or exporting goods secretly and illegally
meanings.sent1: The criminals were caught smuggling contraband across the border.
meanings.sent2: The authorities discovered a case of smuggling at the port.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was smuggling treats from the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a masterful smuggling operation, hiding her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The image of the smuggled goods hidden in the truck remained vivid in his mind.

meanings.definition: The act of transporting goods secretly and illegally
meanings.sent1: The police were investigating a case of smuggling in the city.
meanings.sent2: Smuggling is a serious crime that can have severe consequences.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a hilarious skit about bumbling smugglers.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the night added an air of mystery to the smuggling operation.
meanings.sent5: The movie depicted the thrilling world of international smuggling with great detail.

meanings.definition: To bring goods into or out of a country secretly and illegally
meanings.sent1: The group attempted to smuggle valuable artifacts out of the country.
meanings.sent2: Smuggling endangered species is a major concern for conservationists.
meanings.sent3: The magician joked about smuggling rabbits out of his hat.
meanings.sent4: The music festival felt like a massive smuggling operation for snacks.
meanings.sent5: The novel described the risky business of smuggling goods across borders.
